quizzes.title: History Quiz: Karl Rove and Robert Mcnamara
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, people, conspirators. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Karl Rove stole campaign letterheads from this Democrats campaign office in 1970 and printed the statement: free beer, free food and a good time for nothing under the letterhead. No one learned of the crime until 1973. This state treasurer still won the election regardless of Karl Roves trickery.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alan J. Dixon

questions.question: Karl Rove worked for Bill Clements 1978 gubernatorial campaign in Texas. What distinction does Clements have in Texas history?

options.text: He served the shortest term of any state party chairman in the history of Texas.
He was the first Republican Governor of Texas in over 100 years.
He was the first black candidate for the Texas State Senate running as a Republican.
He won by the largest vote in Texas history.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was the first Republican Governor of Texas in over 100 years.

questions.question: Karl Roves mother committed suicide.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: How did Karl Rove say he lost his first political battle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The neighbor beat him up.

questions.question: Robert McNamara was Secretary of Defense during what war?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vietnam War

questions.question: Karl Rove is often referred to as Bushs ____________.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brain

questions.question: Karl Rove was married in 1977 and divorced in 1980.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In 1960, Robert McNamara became the president of what popular auto manufacturer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ford

questions.question: While working with Donald Segretti, one of the Watergate conspirators, Karl Rove managed to paint this presidential hopeful as a liberal peacenik even though the presidential candidate had a military career as a WW II pilot.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George McGovern

questions.question: Robert McNamara was the 11th US Secretary of Defense.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: After his wifes death in 1981 Robert McNamara was involved with Katharine Graham who ran what popular news publication?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Washington Post

questions.question: Karl Rove was abandoned by his biological father at an early age.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In what year was Robert McNamara born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1916

questions.question: Robert McNamara was not a member of the Armed Forces.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Robert McNamara served as Secretary of Defense under which 2 Presidents?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kennedy/Johnson

quizzes.title: History Quiz: North America and Isaac Newton
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, college, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these ethnic groups belongs to the Sioux Native American people?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What was the name of Isaac Newtons wife?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: What is the name of the dwellings used by the Navajo people of North America?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hogans

questions.question: Robert McNamaras first wife Margaret McNamara, a former teacher, used her position as a Cabinet spouse to launch a reading program for young children. What was the name of the program?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Reading Is Fundamental

questions.question: What statement is true about the Apache tribes from North America?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They were fierce warriors.

questions.question: The Seneca nation of North America referred to themselves as Onondowaga. What does this mean?

options.text: People of the Sun and the Moon

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: People of the Great Hill

questions.question: Robert McNamara died in the same city he was born in.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The bark of what tree did the Ojibwe tribe from North America use for making canoes and scrolls?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Birch

questions.question: In what country was Isaac Newton born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: England

questions.question: What song was traditionally performed at the wedding ceremonies of the Mohawk nation of North America?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rabbit Dance Song

questions.question: The Cherokee people call themselves Tsalagi. What does this mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Principal people

questions.question: What was the main food source for the Abenaki tribe of North America in the past?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Crops

questions.question: At the Trinity College in Cambridge, Isaac Newton was taught solely according to the ideas of which ancient philosopher?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aristotle

questions.question: What author wrote his novel The Last of the Mohicans based on the Mahican tribe of North America?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Fenimore Cooper

questions.question: What was the most precious gift for the Comanche Native American tribe?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Children

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Isaac Newton and Actor
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, actor, field. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This French comedian and actor is known for his irreverent attitude towards politics.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mishel Colucci

questions.question: Charles De Gaulle served as president of France from 1959 to 1969.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Pierre Abbe founded a charitable movement aimed at helping poor and homeless people.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Victor Hugo is the author of The Hunchback of Notre Dame and Les Misérables.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: After Isaac Newtons death, chemical analysis showed that he had been exposed to immense amounts of which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mercury

questions.question: Apart from his work in the field of physics, Isaac Newton is known for exploring which of the following on a daily basis?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bible

questions.question: Name the first scientist honored with two Nobel Prizes - in physics and chemistry.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marie Curie

questions.question: What important position did Isaac Newton assume in 1696?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Warden of the Royal Mint

questions.question: This actor appeared in the movies Christmas Tree (1969) , All the Gold in the World (1961) and Hunchback (1959).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: André Bourvil

questions.question: Which of these is true about Isaac Newton?

options.text: He was the first scientist in history to be knighted.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was the first scientist in history to be knighted.

questions.question: This notable microbiologist created the first vaccine for rabies and anthrax.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Louis Pasteur

questions.question: What is the stage name of Jean-Baptiste Poquelin, the 17th century satirical author and actor who is considered to be the father of French comedy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Molière

questions.question: Isaac Newton’s mother removed him from school as she wanted him to be which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Farmer

questions.question: What object did Isaac Newton use to demonstrate the decomposition of white light into a color spectrum?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Prism

questions.question: The falling of what fruit on the ground inspired Isaac Newton to formulate his theory of gravitation?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Apple

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Inventor and Pamela Anderson
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, people, anderson. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these French chemists invented margarine in 1869?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hippolyte Mège-Mouriés

questions.question: Which of these was invented by Whitcomb Judson?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the zipper

questions.question: Of what descent is Pamela Anderson?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Russian and Finnish

questions.question: Which of these American inventors made the first dishwasher?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Josephine Cochrane

questions.question: This English inventor, to whom we owe the modern fire extinguisher, has also developed a device for saving life from shipwrecks.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George William Manby

questions.question: This Scottish physician is one of the founders of the University of London and the inventor of the waterbed.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Neil Arnott

questions.question: Which of these Swedish inventors is responsible for the adjustable spanner and the pipe wrench?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johan Petter Johansson

questions.question: Pamela Anderson was born on July 1, 1967 in this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Canada

questions.question: This American physicist of Bulgarian descent is the inventor of the first automatic electronic digital computer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Atanasoff

questions.question: Jacques Cousteau was an underwater explorer, researcher and TV show host.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This Swedish inventor is responsible for the seatbelt, and has also helped with the development of the ejection seat in airplanes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nils Bohlin

questions.question: This American film producer, considered to be the father of American animation, is the inventor of the stop-motion film.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: J. Stuart Blackton

questions.question: This French singer became universally regarded as a cultural icon and symbol of France. Her nickname is a colloquialism for sparrow.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Édith Piaf

questions.question: This famous English philosopher, also known as Doctor Mirabilis, is the inventor of the magnifying glass.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roger Bacon

questions.question: What was Pamela Andersons occupation in Vancouver, Canada, where she moved after graduating from high school?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fitness instructor

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Pamela Anderson and Queen Nefertiti
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, people, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In which of the movies from the Scary Movie sequence did Pamela Anderson appear?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Scary Movie 3

questions.question: How many children did Queen Nefertiti and her husband have according to archaeological findings?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Six daughters

questions.question: Which of these titles found in the Karnak temple complex refer to Queen Nefertiti?

options.text: Mistress of Upper and Lower Egypt

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mistress of Upper and Lower Egypt

questions.question: What Egyptian Pharaoh is believed to have acceded to the Egyptian throne after Queen Nefertiti?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tutankhamun

questions.question: To what Egyptian Pharaoh was the Egyptian Queen Nefertiti married?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What was the name of Pamela Andersons first husband, whom she married on February 19, 1995?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tommy Lee

questions.question: What is the name of the book written by Pamela Anderson and published in 2004?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Star

questions.question: What superhero character did Pamela Anderson portray in the 2008 spoof movie Superhero Movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Invisible Girl

questions.question: What specific archaeological finding suggests that Queen Nefertiti was given unprecedented power in Egypt?

options.text: She was described in words that were used only for kings before that
She was portrayed in kings attire
She was depicted with a cobra on her head
She was depicted the same size as the king

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She was depicted the same size as the king

questions.question: The Egyptian Queen Nefertiti has always been admired as a representation of beauty. What part of her body is considered especially attractive?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Neck

questions.question: What was the title of the TV series in which Pamela Anderson starred from 1998 to 2002?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: V.I.P.

questions.question: What caused Pamela Anderson to become a vegetarian when she was a child?

options.text: Her mother was a vegetarian and she talked her into it.
She heard from TV that meat can cause cancer.
She saw her father cleaning a killed animal.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She saw her father cleaning a killed animal.

questions.question: What important change did the Egyptian Queen Nefertiti and her husband introduce to Ancient Egypt?

options.text: They made the army exclusively professional
They introduced the 24-hour division of the day

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They changed the religion

questions.question: What sculptor is widely believed to have worked on the famous bust of Nefertiti?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thutmose

questions.question: What was the name of Pamela Andersons character on the popular TV show Baywatch?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: C. J. Parker

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Actress and Movies
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This Italian actress, filmmaker and author is perhaps best known for her roles in the movies Blue Velvet and Death Becomes Her.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Isabella Rossellini

questions.question: This Italian actress and fashion model played the title role in the Italian romantic drama film Malena. She was also featured in the Hollywood movies Tears of the Sun and The Passion of the Christ.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Monica Bellucci

questions.question: Who was a tailor before assuming the Office of the President?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andrew Johnson

questions.question: This actress starred in the Academy Award-winning movies La Strada and Nights of Cabiria, both of which were directed by her husband Federico Fellini.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Giulietta Masina

questions.question: Which of these legendary musicians released his album Nefertiti in 1968?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Miles Davis

questions.question: What is believed to have caused Queen Nefertitis death?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Plague

questions.question: This Italian actress appeared in some of the most prominent European films of the 1960s and 1970s, including Federico Fellinis 8½ and Sergio Leones epic Once Upon a Time in the West.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Claudia Cardinale

questions.question: Who was a sheriff before being elected President of the United States?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grover Cleveland

questions.question: What Italian actor won the Academy Award for Best Actor for his role in the 1997 tragicomedy Life Is Beautiful?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roberto Benigni

questions.question: This movie legend has won more than fifty international awards, including two Academy Awards. She gained international fame with the movies Desire Under the Elms and Houseboat.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sophia Loren

questions.question: Who was a school principal before assuming the role of President of the United States?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chester Arthur

questions.question: What prominent Italian actor starred in Federico Fellinis comedy-drama films La Dolce Vita and 8½?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marcello Mastroianni

questions.question: In 1950, this Italian actress, photojournalist and sculptress refused Howard Hughes invitation to make Hollywood films, preferring to work in Europe. Nevertheless, her appearance in Italian films like Bread, Love and Dreams and Woman of Rome brought her to the attention of Hollywood.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gina Lollobrigida

questions.question: This Italian actor, sometimes credited as Montgomery Wood, starred in spaghetti westerns such as A Pistol for Ringo, Blood for a Silver Dollar and Day of Anger.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Giuliano Gemma

questions.question: In 1967, this Italian actor portrayed Lancelot in the movie Camelot where he met his long time romantic partner and future wife, Vanessa Redgrave.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Franco Nero
